chapter.title: Creating the Web Application
chapter.para: The two main configuration files, Site/WEB-INF/web.xml and Site/WEB-INF/configuration.xml, must exist for a web application using &framework-name; libraries. Both Java servlets and JSPs can be used by the developer using &product-name; libraries.

section.title: JSPs
section.para: All JSP files (or the directories in which they reside) must exist under Site directory.

section.title: Servlet
section.para:
All Java classes must exist under Site/WEB-INF/classes and all Java libraries must exist under Site/WEB-INF/lib directory. Servlets can be named and mapped in Site/WEB-INF/web.xml as shown below:
<servlet> <servlet-name>Navigator</servlet-name> <servlet-class>com.xaf.navigate.NavigateFileSystemServlet</servlet-class> </servlet> <servlet-mapping> <servlet-name>Navigator</servlet-name> <url-pattern>/navigate/*</url-pattern> </servlet-mapping>
The above example is a navigation servlet provided by &framework-name; and can be used to display directory listings.
